    • Field Detail

      • FAST_RATE

        private static final double FAST_RATE
        The rate used when fast forwarding or rewinding. Don't make this too high, or the interpolate method of Transition won't get a chance to change its relevant value.
        See Also:
        Animation.rateProperty(), Constant Field Values

      • NORMAL_RATE

        private static final double NORMAL_RATE
        The normal rate of progress of an animation.
        See Also:
        Animation.rateProperty(), Constant Field Values

      • create

        private @NonNull Button create()
        Creates a prototype toolbar button. It's disabled by default. Specific customization can be done by overriding build(String, String).
        Returns:
        the button

      • build

        protected @NonNull Button build(@NonNull String text,
                                @NonNull String tooltipText)
        Builds the button from the prototype created by create().
        Parameters:
        text - the text displayed on the button
        tooltipText - the text displayed by the tooltip
        Returns:
        the button

      • build

        public abstract @NonNull Button build()
        Returns:
        the created toolbar button

      • action

        public abstract void action()
        Do something when the button is clicked.

      • executeVisualizerTransition

        public void executeVisualizerTransition(@NonNull Visualizer.PlaybackState pbStateWhilePlaying,
                                        double rate)
        Execute a visualizer (state-)transition. This method assumes a forward or backward transition is possible. If rate is positive, a forward transition is assumed. If the pbStateWhilePlaying is NOT continuous, a 'stepping' transition is assumed: the delay is removed and after the transition is finished, the playback state is set to paused.
        Parameters:
        pbStateWhilePlaying - the playback state set during the transition
        rate - the rate with which the transition will take place. See Animation.rateProperty()
